items: Start by kneeling on the ground with your knees hip-width apart and your toes pointed behind you.
Extend your arms straight out in front of you, shoulder-width apart, and interlace your fingers.
Slowly lower your chest towards the ground, keeping your arms extended and your hands interlaced.
Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your lats and upper back.
Slowly release the stretch and return to the starting position.
Repeat the stretch for 2-3 sets, taking a short break in between each set.
Improves flexibility and range of motion in the shoulders and upper back
Reduces tension and tightness in the latissimus dorsi muscles
Helps alleviate pain and discomfort in the upper body
Can improve posture and alignment of the spine
May enhance athletic performance in activities that require upper body strength and mobility
